title: and Title of Minister) Order 2010 (S.I. No. 184 of 2010)), having had regard to
heading: 2. (1) The patron of a school shall, in respect of admission to a school in,
text_raw:
2. (1) The patron of a school shall, in respect of admission to a school in, 
or after, September 2021, as soon as practicable but in any case not later than 
the 15th day of September following the receipt by the patron of the draft 
admission policy from the board, approve – 

(a) 

a draft admission policy of the school, in accordance with 
subsection (4), or 

(b) 

the draft admission policy as amended under subsection (5), 

of section 62. 

(2) Where a patron has approved a draft admission policy subject to 
modifications, the board shall as soon as practicable, but in any event not later 
than 2 weeks from the date the patron approved that draft policy subject to 
modifications, make the specified modifications and return the amended policy 
to the patron. 

(3) Not before 1 September 2020 and, in any case, not later than 2 weeks 
after the date of receipt of the admission policy or amended admission policy 
as approved by the patron and forwarded to the board in accordance with 
section 62(6), the board shall –

cause to be published and maintained on a publically-available

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2010 (S.I. No. 184 of 2010)), having had regard to
heading: 3. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), a school may not accept an application
text_raw:
3. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), a school may not accept an application 
from a student for admission to the school’s intake group before the first day of 
October of the year preceding the start of the school year for which admission 
is being sought. 

(2) In the case of admission to a residential place in a boarding school, the 
school may not accept an application from a student for admission to the 
school’s intake group before the first day of October of the year 2 years 
preceding the start of the school year for which admission is being sought.

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2010 (S.I. No. 184 of 2010)), having had regard to
heading: 4. (1) Not later than one week before the date on which a school shall
text_raw:
4. (1) Not later than one week before the date on which a school shall 
commence accepting applications for admission to the school for the school 
year concerned, the board shall – 

(a) 

cause to be published and maintained on a publically-available 
website maintained by the school a copy of its current annual 
admission notice, and 

(b) on written request to the board, make available a copy of its 
current annual admissions notice to a parent, the Minister or a 
member of the public, as the case may be. 

(2) In the case of a school where an offer of admission has been made and 
accepted prior to the coming into operation of section 62, that school shall 
include the number of such places offered and accepted in its annual admission 
notice for the school year concerned.

heading: 5. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), decisions by a school in respect of
text_raw:
5. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), decisions by a school in respect of 
applications for admission to the school shall be notified in writing to the 
applicant not later than 3 weeks after the closing date for the submission of 
such applications, specified in the school’s annual admission notice, for the 
receipt of applications. 

(2) Decisions by a school in respect of applications for admission to the 
school, received after the closing date for receiving applications for admission 
to the school, specified in the school’s annual admission notice, shall be

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2010 (S.I. No. 184 of 2010)), having had regard to
heading: 7. Where a primary school is oversubscribed, it may give priority to the
text_raw:
7. Where a primary school is oversubscribed, it may give priority to the 

admission of a student to the intake group on the basis – 

(a) of the earlier date of birth of the student, or 

(b) 

that the student has reached a minimum age, 

subject in all cases to the student being not less than 4 years of age on the first 
day of September of the school year concerned.
